Fix messy paths

Source: R/path_helpers.R
fix_path.Rd

Useful (and simple) wrappers around stringr functions.

str_underscorise(x, pattern = "-+|[[:space:]]+")

str_trim_ext(x, pattern = "\\.[[:alnum:]]+$")

str_trim_dirpath(x, pattern = "^.*/")

Arguments

x

character
pattern

regex (a regular expression)

Value

character

Functions

  • str_underscorise: turn dashes and spaces into underscores

  • str_trim_ext: trim extension

  • str_trim_dirpath: trim dirpath

See also

To extract information from paths see extract_path

To fix information from paths, besides these ones, you have plenty friends in stringr, and particularly:

  • stringr::str_to_lower: lowercase them all

  • stringr::str_trim: remove whitespace from start and end of string

Other path: extract_path

Examples

messy_paths
#> [1] "Big_one/folder-foo/file_n.jpg" "folder-foo/File n.jpg"        
#> [3] "folder-foo2/file   5.jpg"      "file.txt"                     
#> [5] "file.jpeg"                     "file.png"                     
#> [7] "file.mom"                     
messy_paths %>% str_underscorise()
#> [1] "Big_one/folder_foo/file_n.jpg" "folder_foo/File_n.jpg"        
#> [3] "folder_foo2/file_5.jpg"        "file.txt"                     
#> [5] "file.jpeg"                     "file.png"                     
#> [7] "file.mom"
